channel.title: I need help decompiling a .class?
channel.description:
kk well I'm pretty sure there has to be a way to get a [i].java[/i] out of a [i].class[/i] I just need a little assistance from you guys.
So any help will be greatly appreciated. :)

item.title: I need help decompiling a .class?
item.dc:creator: @_cake _cake
item.description:
@_cake wrote:

an example of what sL means is [code]…
getstatic #2
invokevirtual #3
iconst_1
iadd
putstatic #4
…

CPool:
#0: Reserved by JVM
…
#2: Constant_FIELDREF Ltype; class_t.field
#3: Constant_METHODREF I type.getint()
#4: Constant_FIELDREF I class_t.field2
…

|
|
|
\ /
+

class type {
int getint() {
return 0;
}
}
class class_t {
static type field;
static int field2;
static {
field = new type();
field2 = 2;
}
}
…
class_t.field2 = class_t.type.getint();
…[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: I need help decompiling a .class?
item.dc:creator: @haxerownsmopar haxerownsmopar
item.description:
@haxerownsmopar wrote:

[quote=“speedster239, post:22, topic:159749”][quote author=Silver Lining link=topic=217493.msg1902780#msg1902780 date=1196230467]
Be an unpussy and decompile it by hand.
[/quote]

I use Cavaj Java decompiler most of the time but I’ll warn you that your going to have to do alot of “changing around” to even get the decompiled “source” to recompile again. If your patient enough it shouldn’t take much though.[/quote]

the bits that it doesnt do corectly just use jode on

Read full topic

item.title: I need help decompiling a .class?
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

[quote="_cake, post:5, topic:159749"][quote author=mjordan link=topic=217493.msg1892185#msg1892185 date=1195782741]
Well I google and found JAD yesterday, but can’t figure out how to use it. All there is is that .exe and the readme file, but the readme is really unclear.
[/quote]
JAD -s java MyClass.class
or
JAD -s java *.class
The -s means specify suffix, and java means make the suffix ‘java’.[/quote]

0.o i never knew that, i used to make a bat file saying

jad *.class
rename *.class *.java

nice

Read full topic

item.title: I need help decompiling a .class?
item.dc:creator: @_cake _cake
item.description:
@_cake wrote:

Greeny:

If this is decompiling non obfuscated classes I recommend Cavaj.

Cavaj uses JAD to decompile the classes to java files in a temp directory then loads them from there.

Read full topic

item.title: I need help decompiling a .class?
item.dc:creator: @_cake _cake
item.description:
@_cake wrote:

[quote=“mjordan, post:6, topic:159749”][quote author=_cake link=topic=217493.msg1892207#msg1892207 date=1195783393]

Well I google and found JAD yesterday, but can’t figure out how to use it. All there is is that .exe and the readme file, but the readme is really unclear.

JAD -s java MyClass.class
or
JAD -s java *.class
The -s means specify suffix, and java means make the suffix ‘java’.
[/quote]Kk but where do I type that in? When I run the .exe it only stays up for about 1 second.[/quote]
Either on the command prompt/terminal or in a batch/shell script and execute.

Read full topic

or
